casebody.data:
Guardianship of JOHN FREDERICK RUNGE. [No. 19,966; decided October 27, 1890.]

Testamentary Guardianship.—If a Father Provides in His Will, in reference to a minor son, that the trustees therein are to “take full charge of him and see to his welfare,” he thereby appoints them guardians of the person of the minor, and the court has no jurisdiction to entertain a petition by another person for letters of guardianship.
